info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 3:08PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN FULTON...NORTHERN FULTON...SOUTHERN HERKIMER...AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 308 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from Northwood to near Clark Mills to Lyndon and moving east at 40 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Cold Brook and Hinckley around 315 PM EST. Ohio around 320 PM EST. Frankfort around 335 PM EST. Ilion, Herkimer and Mohawk around 340 PM EST. Jordanville around 350 PM EST. Little Falls around 355 PM EST. St. Johnsville around 410 PM EST. Fort Plain, Ephratah, West Winfield and Cedarville around 415 PM EST. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 29A and 30. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
